elements.text:
You're working on a report with a few colleagues and need to report some statistics. A colleague suggests that you change the statistics so that your report looks better, but that would be lying.

Here are some feelings that might happen in the moment:

texts: I'm kind of frustrated that my colleague said we should just make up new statistics.
I'm anxious that my colleagues will make fun of me, but if they do, I can handle it.
I'm happier writing this report with my colleagues than when I'm alone.
I'll be relieved when this report is done.
I'm worried about my performance on the report, but I know I'm trying my best.
